result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on February 3, 2023 at 10:00 am.

11:42 AM 
Attorney Robert Lee Taylor in court for Torrence L. Gayton.  Attorney Cass W Cousins in court for State of Wisconsin. 
DA Cousins calls the case and states appearances.
DA Cousins states there is likely to be a plea agreement and that a plea/sentencing hearing needs to be scheduled.
Court makes statements regarding DA Cousins prosecuting the case.
DA Cousins notes that he will look into whether anything else needs to be filed regarding his appearance.

records.addlTxt: Motion and Order to Withdraw as Counsel filed by AAG Cousins (sent to Br 1 Judge on 08/18/22 sp)
Pre-trial conference on October 10, 2022 at 11:30 am.

11:05 AM Defendant Torrence L. Gayton appeared by video from the Milwaukee Detention Facility.  Attorney (Atty) Robert Lee Taylor appeared by video for Torrence L. Gayton.  Attorney Cass W Cousins appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court questions if the defendant can hear and see while using Zoom. Defendant was muted so the court asked to indicate if can see and hear motion with a thumbs up.
Defendant indicates he can hear and see.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.

3:32 PM Defendant Torrence L. Gayton in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Lee Taylor not in court.  Attorney Cass W Cousins in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Written Waiver of Preliminary Hearing had been efiled.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT: On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Arraignment scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:35 PM Defendant Torrence L. Gayton appeared by video, in custody at Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility.   Attorney Robert Lee Taylor for Torrence L. Gayton appeared by video.  Attorney Cass W Cousins for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

State recommends a $5,000 cash bond with conditions as stated.
Atty Taylor objects to the $5,000 cash bond and states his objections on the record.
Defendant will be in custody for approx. 18 months.
Court reviews the complaint.
